ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: If you have four hours each week that you want to spend doing something relaxing and constructive, then take this course. If not, think about why you don't have those four hours.

Take this class. Learn your way around the machine shop, and build a tiny steam engine in the process (which is super impressive to show off to your friends and family, by the by). As an undergrad, if you're at all interested and have the space in your schedule, absolutely go for it. You'll have a great time.

Yes! Definitely recommend this course for people with an extra 4 hours a week to spend in a machine shop learning how to machine metal. This is a really low homework class so the only work you put in is during class time. Super fun.
yes, because i learned a lot from this course.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It gave me some practical experience in modern machining, which is something I can put on my resume and definitely use in an actual job.
Taught me how to use the lathe, mill, and cnc. Definitely feel like I could plan out and fabricate some metal projects of mine now.
